citations.narrative:
On 19 November 2024, a group of yearlings and a doe were brought into the sorting boxes for the handling system for
procedures. On 20 November 2024 during the setup for procedures involving deer, it was found that one yearling deer
had mistakenly been missed from being returned to its primary enclosure the previous day. The deer spent approximately
27 hours in the sorting box for the handling system for procedures without access to feed, water and other deer, which
may have caused distress for the deer. Ensure all handling of animals is done as carefully as possible in a manner that
does not cause harm or distress. The yearling deer involved in this event was observed during this inspection. The facility
initiated correction with a new policy of how inspecting the handling system after procedures is to be completed and
ensuring all deer are returned to their primary enclosure after processing procedures. Corrected prior to inspection.
Maintain correction from 13 February 2025 forward.

An animal event was reported to the IACUC on 20 April 2024 for an IACUC approved protocol involving forty-four young
turkeys. The event involved a total of fourteen turkey deaths from 4/17/2024 - 4/23/2024. Reported were the deaths of two
turkeys on 4/17, one on 4/18, three on 4/19 and seven on 4/20 which was above expected 20 % loss for production of
young turkeys. An additional turkey died on 4/23. The veterinary visit on 4/20 determined that the heat lamps used for
supplemental heat were lamps with a shatterproof coating on the bulbs. The shatterproof coating on the surfaces of the
heat lamp bulbs is toxic to turkeys. Ensure that primary enclosures for poultry have interior surfaces, including furniture
and supplemental lighting, do not have any surface materials that are toxic or hazardous to the poultry. The facility
initiated an immediate corrective action on 4/20/24 of replacing the heat lamps with lamps without shatterproof bulbs and
will maintain a policy that lamps with shatterproof bulbs are not to be used for poultry. Corrected prior to inspection.
Maintain correction from 13 February 2025 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.38(f)(1) 
   
Miscellaneous. 
On 19 November 2024, a group of yearlings and a doe were brought into the sorting boxes for the handling system for 
procedures. On 20 November 2024 during the setup for procedures involving deer, it was found that one yearling deer 
had mistakenly been missed from being returned to its primary enclosure the previous day. The deer spent approximately 
27 hours in the sorting box for the handling system for procedures without access to feed, water and other deer, which 
may have caused distress for the deer. Ensure all handling of animals is done as carefully as possible in a manner that 
does not cause harm or distress. The yearling deer involved in this event was observed during this inspection. The facility 
initiated correction with a new policy of how inspecting the handling system after procedures is to be completed and 
ensuring all deer are returned to their primary enclosure after processing procedures. Corrected prior to inspection. 
Maintain correction from 13 February 2025 forward. 
3.150(c)(1)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
An animal event was reported to the IACUC on 20 April 2024 for an IACUC approved protocol involving forty-four young 
turkeys. The event involved a total of fourteen turkey deaths from 4/17/2024 - 4/23/2024. Reported were the deaths of two 
turkeys on 4/17, one on 4/18, three on 4/19 and seven on 4/20 which was above expected 20 % loss for production of 
young turkeys. An additional turkey died on 4/23. The veterinary visit on 4/20 determined that the heat lamps used for 
supplemental heat were lamps with a shatterproof coating on the bulbs. The shatterproof coating on the surfaces of the 
heat lamp bulbs is toxic to turkeys. Ensure that primary enclosures for poultry have interior surfaces, including furniture 
and supplemental lighting, do not have any surface materials that are toxic or hazardous to the poultry. The facility 
initiated an immediate corrective action on 4/20/24 of replacing the heat lamps with lamps without shatterproof bulbs and 
will maintain a policy that lamps with shatterproof bulbs are not to be used for poultry. Corrected prior to inspection. 
Maintain correction from 13 February 2025 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representatives. 
 
End of report.

n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
